message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with depth estimation from videos using appearance, motion, and geometric context. The use of Markov random fields (MRF) also suggests a probabilistic modeling approach, which is commonly used in computer vision. The paper also mentions the use of spatio-temporal regions, which suggests a focus on video analysis. 

The paper may also belong to the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category as depth estimation is an important task in robotics for tasks such as obstacle avoidance and navigation. 

The use of machine learning techniques such as learning mappings and temporal smoothing suggests a focus on machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. 

Finally, the use of geometric context and planar parametrization suggests a focus on computational geometry (cs.CG) sub-category.
